text: The University of Belgrade is a public research university in Belgrade, Serbia. It is the oldest and largest university in Serbia. It started in 1808 as the Belgrade Higher School in revolutionary Serbia, by 1838 it merged with the Kragujevac-based departments into a single university. The university has around 97,700 enrolled students and over 4,800 academic staff members.Since it started the university has educated more than 378,000 bachelors, around 25,100 magisters, 29,000 specialists and 14,670 doctors. The university has 31 faculties, 12 research institutes, the university library, and 9 university centres. The faculties are organized into four groups: social sciences and humanities; medical sciences; natural sciences and mathematics; and technological sciences. ==References== Category:Colleges and universities in Serbia Category:Organizations based in Belgrade Category:1808 establishments Category:1800s establishments in Europe Category:Establishments in Serbia
title: University of Belgrade
